name: Hummus
description: Authentic Middle Eastern chickpea dip with tahini, lemon, and garlic. Creamy, protein-rich appetizer.

instructions.instruction: Drain canned chickpeas but SAVE THE LIQUID (aquafaba). Rinse chickpeas under cold water.
instructions.tip: Aquafaba is liquid gold for creaminess.

instructions.instruction: Stir tahini well in its jar. Oil and solids may have separated.
Add tahini to food processor or powerful blender first. Process for 30 seconds.
instructions.tip: Processing tahini first yields smoother results.

instructions.instruction: Add lemon juice and minced garlic. Process another 30 seconds.
Add ice cubes. Process on high for 1 minute.
instructions.tip: Ice makes hummus incredibly light and creamy - Lebanese secret!

instructions.instruction: Add half the chickpeas. Process 1 minute, scrape sides with spatula.
Add remaining chickpeas, olive oil, cumin, and salt.
Process on high for 3-5 minutes continuously until completely smooth and creamy.
instructions.tip: Be patient - long processing is the secret. Scrape sides occasionally.

instructions.instruction: Check consistency. If too thick, add 1-2 tbsp aquafaba and process again.
instructions.tip: Should be scoopable but not runny.

instructions.instruction: Taste and adjust salt or lemon juice as needed.
Transfer to serving plate with a spoon. Create a well in the center with back of spoon.
Pour olive oil into the well. Sprinkle paprika and parsley on top.
instructions.tip: Traditionally, whole chickpeas and pine nuts are also added.

tips: Quality tahini makes all the difference - choose smooth, non-bitter brands.
Homemade hummus is far superior to store-bought.
Peeling chickpea skins gives extra smoothness but isn't required.
Tastes even better the next day - flavors meld.
storageInfo: Refrigerate in airtight container for 5-7 days. Freezing not recommended.
servingSuggestion: Serve with pita bread, carrot and cucumber sticks, or red pepper slices. Star of any mezze platter.
variations: Roasted red pepper: Add 1/2 cup roasted peppers.
Extra garlic: Double the garlic amount.
Avocado: Add 1 ripe avocado for extra creaminess.
Spicy: Add 1 tsp sriracha or harissa.
